messages.content: You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about college course syllabi. Provide accurate, concise answers based on syllabus information.
What are the prerequisites for machine learning courses?

Machine learning courses typically require: (1) Linear Algebra - understanding matrices and vector operations, (2) Calculus - particularly derivatives and optimization, (3) Programming experience in Python, and (4) Basic probability and statistics. Some advanced ML courses may also require prior coursework in data structures and algorithms.
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about college course syllabi. Provide accurate, concise answers based on syllabus information.

The following courses cover neural networks: (1) Deep Learning (CS 230) - comprehensive coverage of CNNs, RNNs, and transformers, (2) Machine Learning (CS 229) - introduces basic neural networks and backpropagation, (3) Computer Vision (CS 231n) - focuses on convolutional neural networks for image processing, (4) Natural Language Processing (CS 224n) - covers recurrent networks and attention mechanisms.
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about college course syllabi. Provide accurate, concise answers based on syllabus information.
What programming languages are required for data science courses?

Data science courses primarily require Python, which is used for data analysis (pandas, numpy), visualization (matplotlib, seaborn), and machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow). Some courses also use R for statistical computing, and SQL for database queries. Advanced courses may introduce Scala for big data processing with Spark.

What are typical grading policies in computer science courses?

Typical grading breakdown includes: Homework/Problem Sets (30-40%), Midterm Exam (20-25%), Final Exam (25-30%), and Projects (15-25%). Some courses include participation (5-10%). Late submission policies vary: most allow 1-3 late days with penalties of 10-20% per day. Academic integrity is strictly enforced with potential course failure for violations.
You are a helpful assistant that answers questions about college course syllabi. Provide accurate, concise answers based on syllabus information.
Are there courses with group projects?

Yes, several courses include group projects: (1) Software Engineering - semester-long team project building a complete application, (2) Human-Computer Interaction - group design and user testing projects, (3) Deep Learning - optional final project can be done in teams of 2-3, (4) Database Systems - group project designing and implementing a database application. Group sizes typically range from 2-4 students.
